chapter.title: Nepomuk File Ontology (NFO): About files and other desktop resources.

listitem.para: © 2007 DFKI © 2009 Nokia. The ontologies are made available under the terms of NEPOMUK software license (FIXME verify)

refsect2.title: nfo:FileDataObject
refsect2.para: A resource containing a finite sequence of bytes with arbitrary information, that is available to a computer program and is usually based on some kind of durable storage. A file is durable in the sense that it remains available for programs to use after the current program has finished.

listitem.simpara: nfo:fileLastModified, nfo:fileOwner, nfo:hasHash, nfo:fileName, nfo:permissions, nfo:fileSize, nfo:fileCreated, nfo:fileLastAccessed,

refsect2.title: nfo:Video
refsect2.para: A video file.

refsect2.title: nfo:MediaList
refsect2.para: A file containing a list of media files.e.g. a playlist

refsect2.title: nfo:Executable
refsect2.para: An executable file.

refsect2.title: nfo:SoftwareCategory
refsect2.para: A software category

refsect2.title: nfo:SourceCode
refsect2.para: Code in a compilable or interpreted programming language.

refsect2.title: nfo:RemotePortAddress
refsect2.para: An address specifying a remote host and port. Such an address can be interpreted in many ways (examples of such interpretations include mailboxes, websites, remote calendars or filesystems), depending on an interpretation, various kinds of data may be extracted from such an address.

refsect2.title: nfo:Cursor
refsect2.para: A Cursor.

refsect2.title: nfo:RegionOfInterest
refsect2.para: Area on an image with relevant content. Following the spec in http://www.metadataworkinggroup.org

listitem.simpara: nfo:roiRefersTo, nfo:regionOfInterestType, nfo:regionOfInterestHeight, nfo:regionOfInterestWidth, nfo:regionOfInterestY, nfo:regionOfInterestX,

refsect2.title: nfo:Document
refsect2.para: A generic document. A common superclass for all documents on the desktop.

listitem.simpara: nfo:HelpDocument, nfo:Note, nfo:MindMap, nfo:Spreadsheet, nfo:Presentation, nfo:TextDocument,

refsect2.title: nfo:Presentation
refsect2.para: A Presentation made by some presentation software (Corel Presentations, OpenOffice Impress, MS Powerpoint etc.)

refsect2.title: nfo:RemoteDataObject
refsect2.para: A file data object stored at a remote location. Don't confuse this class with a RemotePortAddress. This one applies to a particular resource, RemotePortAddress applies to an address, that can have various interpretations.

refsect2.title: nfo:Software
refsect2.para: A piece of software. Examples may include applications and the operating system. This interpretation most commonly applies to SoftwareItems.

refsect2.title: nfo:ArchiveItem
refsect2.para: A file entity inside an archive.

refsect2.title: nfo:HardDiskPartition
refsect2.para: A partition on a hard disk

refsect2.title: nfo:Font
refsect2.para: A font.

refsect2.title: nfo:FilesystemImage
refsect2.para: An image of a filesystem. Instances of this class may include CD images, DVD images or hard disk partition images created by various pieces of software (e.g. Norton Ghost)

refsect2.title: nfo:HelpDocument
refsect2.para: User guides and similar to assist the user

refsect2.title: nfo:DeletedResource
refsect2.para: A file entity that has been deleted from the original source. Usually such entities are stored within various kinds of 'Trash' or 'Recycle Bin' folders.

refsect2.title: nfo:RasterImage
refsect2.para: A raster image.

refsect2.title: nfo:MindMap
refsect2.para: A MindMap, created by a mind-mapping utility. Examples might include FreeMind or mind mapper.

refsect2.title: nfo:Note
refsect2.para: Usually small document with snippets, reminders or frequenly used content.

refsect2.title: nfo:PlainTextDocument
refsect2.para: A file containing plain text (ASCII, Unicode or other encodings). Examples may include TXT, HTML, XML, program source code etc.

refsect2.title: nfo:Spreadsheet
refsect2.para: A spreadsheet, created by a spreadsheet application. Examples might include Gnumeric, OpenOffice Calc or MS Excel.

refsect2.title: nfo:Trash
refsect2.para: Represents a container for deleted files, a feature common in modern operating systems.

refsect2.title: nfo:Media
refsect2.para: A piece of media content. This class may be used to express complex media containers with many streams of various media content (both aural and visual).

listitem.simpara: nfo:lastPlayedPosition, nfo:equipment, nfo:genre, nfo:averageBitrate, nfo:bitrateType, nfo:encodedBy, nfo:codec, nfo:bitDepth, nfo:hasMediaStream, nfo:compressionType, nfo:duration, nfo:count,

refsect2.title: nfo:SoftwareService
refsect2.para: A service published by a piece of software, either by an operating system or an application. Examples of such services may include calendar, addresbook and mailbox managed by a PIM application. This category is introduced to distinguish between data available directly from the applications (Via some Interprocess Communication Mechanisms) and data available from files on a disk. In either case both DataObjects would receive a similar interpretation (e.g. a Mailbox) and wouldn't differ on the content level.

refsect2.title: nfo:WebHistory
refsect2.para: A web history entry

refsect2.title: nfo:HtmlDocument
refsect2.para: A HTML document, may contain links to other files.

refsect2.title: nfo:TextDocument
refsect2.para: A text document

refsect2.title: nfo:SoftwareItem
refsect2.para: A DataObject representing a piece of software. Examples of interpretations of a SoftwareItem include an Application and an OperatingSystem.

refsect2.title: nfo:OperatingSystem
refsect2.para: An OperatingSystem

refsect2.title: nfo:PaginatedTextDocument
refsect2.para: A file containing a text document, that is unambiguously divided into pages. Examples might include PDF, DOC, PS', DVI etc.

refsect2.title: nfo:MediaFileListEntry
refsect2.para: A single node in the list of media files contained within an MediaList instance. This class is intended to provide a type all those links have. In valid NRL untyped resources cannot be linked. There are no properties defined for this class but the application may expect rdf:first and rdf:last links. The former points to the DataObject instance, interpreted as Media the latter points at another MediaFileListEntr. At the end of the list there is a link to rdf:nil.

refsect2.title: nfo:Folder
refsect2.para: A folder/directory. Examples of folders include folders on a filesystem and message folders in a mailbox.

refsect2.title: nfo:Filesystem
refsect2.para: A filesystem. Examples of filesystems include hard disk partitions, removable media, but also images thereof stored in files.

refsect2.title: nfo:Image
refsect2.para: A file containing an image.

refsect2.title: nfo:CompressionType
refsect2.para: Type of compression. Instances of this class represent the limited set of values allowed for the nfo:compressionType property.

refsect2.title: nfo:FileHash
refsect2.para: A fingerprint of the file, generated by some hashing function.

refsect2.title: nfo:MediaStream
refsect2.para: A stream of multimedia content, usually contained within a media container such as a movie (containing both audio and video) or a DVD (possibly containing many streams of audio and video). Most common interpretations for such a DataObject include Audio and Video.

refsect2.title: nfo:Attachment
refsect2.para: A file attached to another data object. Many data formats allow for attachments: emails, vcards, ical events, id3 and exif...

refsect2.title: nfo:Equipment
refsect2.para: The equipment used to create media

refsect2.title: nfo:Website
refsect2.para: A website, usually a container for remote resources, that may be interpreted as HTMLDocuments, images or other types of content.

refsect2.title: nfo:Application
refsect2.para: An application

refsect2.title: nfo:EmbeddedFileDataObject
refsect2.para: A file embedded in another data object. There are many ways in which a file may be embedded in another one. Use this class directly only in cases if none of the subclasses gives a better description of your case.

refsect2.title: nfo:DataContainer
refsect2.para: A superclass for all entities, whose primary purpose is to serve as containers for other data object. They usually don't have any 'meaning' by themselves. Examples include folders, archives and optical disc images.

refsect2.title: nfo:BookmarkFolder
refsect2.para: A folder with bookmarks of a webbrowser. Use nfo:containsBookmark to relate Bookmarks. Folders can contain subfolders, use containsBookmarkFolder to relate them.

refsect2.title: nfo:Audio
refsect2.para: A file containing audio content

listitem.simpara: nfo:audioOffset, nfo:peakGain, nfo:gain, nfo:rearChannels, nfo:averageAudioBitrate, nfo:sampleRate, nfo:frontChannels, nfo:bitsPerSample, nfo:sampleCount, nfo:lfeChannels, nfo:sideChannels, nfo:channels,

refsect2.title: nfo:Archive
refsect2.para: A compressed file. May contain other files or folder inside.

refsect2.title: nfo:Visual
refsect2.para: File containing visual content.

listitem.simpara: nfo:colorDepth, nfo:width, nfo:height, nfo:interlaceMode, nfo:tilt, nfo:heading, nfo:aspectRatio,

refsect2.title: nfo:Icon
refsect2.para: An Icon (regardless of whether it's a raster or a vector icon. A resource representing an icon could have two types (Icon and Raster, or Icon and Vector) if required.

refsect2.title: nfo:RegionOfInterestContent
refsect2.para: Content in the area. There is a predefined set of contents in the spec: http://www.metadataworkinggroup.org

refsect2.title: nfo:Bookmark
refsect2.para: A bookmark of a webbrowser. Use nie:title for the name/label, nie:contentCreated to represent the date when the user added the bookmark, and nie:contentLastModified for modifications. nfo:bookmarks to store the link.

refsect2.title: nfo:SoftwareApplication
refsect2.para: An application

refsect2.title: nfo:Orientation
refsect2.para: Orientation enum

listitem.simpara: nfo:orientation-left, nfo:orientation-right-mirror, nfo:orientation-right, nfo:orientation-left-mirror, nfo:orientation-bottom-mirror, nfo:orientation-bottom, nfo:orientation-top-mirror, nfo:orientation-top,

refsect2.title: nfo:softwareCategoryIcon
refsect2.para: Icon of the software

refsect2.title: nfo:hasMediaStream
refsect2.para: Connects a media container with a single media stream contained within.

refsect2.title: nfo:entryCounter
refsect2.para: Number of entries in the list. Optimize some common queries

refsect2.title: nfo:isPasswordProtected
refsect2.para: States if a given resource is password-protected.

refsect2.title: nfo:regionOfInterestWidth
refsect2.para: Width of the region. It is normalized (values between 0 and 1) to the total width of the picture.

refsect2.title: nfo:hasRegionOfInterest
refsect2.para: Link an element with a defined region

refsect2.title: nfo:hashAlgorithm
refsect2.para: Name of the algorithm used to compute the hash value. Examples might include CRC32, MD5, SHA, TTH etc.

refsect2.title: nfo:frameCount
refsect2.para: The amount of frames in a video sequence.

refsect2.title: nfo:belongsToContainer
refsect2.para: Models the containment relations between Files and Folders (or CompressedFiles).

refsect2.title: nfo:gain
refsect2.para: Gain of media

refsect2.title: nfo:colorDepth
refsect2.para: Amount of bits used to express the color of each pixel.

refsect2.title: nfo:tilt
refsect2.para: Vertical inclination of the camera while capturing the image, in angles starting on 0 as horizontal, positive numbers pointing up, negative angles pointing down

refsect2.title: nfo:channels
refsect2.para: Number of channels. This property is to be used directly if no detailed information is necessary. Otherwise use more detailed subproperties.

refsect2.title: nfo:listPosition
refsect2.para: Position of an entry in a list. Double, to optimize the poor insertions

refsect2.title: nfo:tableOfContents
refsect2.para: Section titles and figure descriptions of the document.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nfo:deletionDate
refsect2.para: The date and time of the deletion.

refsect2.title: nfo:conflicts
refsect2.para: States that a piece of software is in conflict with another piece of software.

refsect2.title: nfo:definesGlobalVariable
refsect2.para: Name of a global variable defined within the source code file.

refsect2.title: nfo:wordCount
refsect2.para: The amount of words in a text document.

refsect2.title: nfo:containsBookmarkFolder
refsect2.para: The folder contains a bookmark folder.

refsect2.title: nfo:frameRate
refsect2.para: Amount of video frames per second.

refsect2.title: nfo:rearChannels
refsect2.para: Number of rear channels.

refsect2.title: nfo:regionOfInterestX
refsect2.para: Coordinate X where the region starts. It is normalized (values between 0 and 1) to the width of the picture. Starting in the upper left corner.

refsect2.title: nfo:mediaListEntry
refsect2.para: A certain item belongs to a media list. This can reflect that a song is in a playlist, an image or video in an Album

refsect2.title: nfo:regionOfInterestY
refsect2.para: Coordinate y where the region starts. It is normalized (values between 0 and 1) to the height of the picture. Starting in the upper left corner.

refsect2.title: nfo:bookmarks
refsect2.para: The address of the linked object. Usually a web URL.

refsect2.title: nfo:supercedes
refsect2.para: States that a piece of software supercedes another piece of software.

refsect2.title: nfo:containsBookmark
refsect2.para: The folder contains a bookmark.

refsect2.title: nfo:isContentEncrypted
refsect2.para: Might change (IE of DataObject property?)

refsect2.title: nfo:fileCreated
refsect2.para: File creation date

refsect2.title: nfo:sampleCount
refsect2.para: The amount of samples in an audio clip.

refsect2.title: nfo:compressionType
refsect2.para: The type of the compression. Values include, lossy and lossless.

refsect2.title: nfo:isBootable
refsect2.para: True when the file is bootable, for example like an ISO or other disc images

refsect2.title: nfo:listDuration
refsect2.para: Sum of the duration of all items in the list. Optimize some common queries. In seconds

refsect2.title: nfo:regionOfInterestHeight
refsect2.para: Height of the region. It is normalized (values between 0 and 1) to the total height of the picture.

refsect2.title: nfo:model
refsect2.para: The model of the equipment

refsect2.title: nfo:aspectRatio
refsect2.para: Visual content aspect ratio. (Width divided by Height)

refsect2.title: nfo:hashValue
refsect2.para: The actual value of the hash.

refsect2.title: nfo:heading
refsect2.para: Specifies the direction of travelling while capturing image/video. The range of values from 0.00 to 359.99 (where 0 is due North, 90 is East, 180 South and 270 is West)

refsect2.title: nfo:commentCharacterCount
refsect2.para: The amount of character in comments i.e. characters ignored by the compiler/interpreter.

refsect2.title: nfo:permissions
refsect2.para: A string containing the permissions of a file. A feature common in many UNIX-like operating systems.

refsect2.title: nfo:duration
refsect2.para: Duration of a media piece.

refsect2.title: nfo:manufacturer
refsect2.para: The manufacturer of the equipment

refsect2.title: nfo:lastPlayedPosition
refsect2.para: Position in the media (in seconds) where the play was paused. Positive number, being 0 the beginning of the media.

refsect2.title: nfo:sideChannels
refsect2.para: Number of side channels

refsect2.title: nfo:hasHash
refsect2.para: Links the file with it's hash value.

refsect2.title: nfo:foundry
refsect2.para: The foundry, the organization that created the font.

refsect2.title: nfo:interlaceMode
refsect2.para: True if the image is interlaced, false if not.

refsect2.title: nfo:entryUrl
refsect2.para: URL to the element in certain position of the list

refsect2.title: nfo:fontFamily
refsect2.para: The name of the font family.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nfo:pageCount
refsect2.para: Number of pages.

refsect2.title: nfo:definesClass
refsect2.para: Name of a class defined in the source code file.

refsect2.title: nfo:fileLastAccessed
refsect2.para: Time when the file was last accessed.

refsect2.title: nfo:equipmentSoftware
refsect2.para: The software of the equipment

refsect2.title: nfo:encodedBy
refsect2.para: The contains the name of the person or organisation that encoded the media

refsect2.title: nfo:averageBitrate
refsect2.para: The average overall bitrate of a media container. (i.e. the size of the piece of media in bits, divided by it's duration expressed in seconds).

refsect2.title: nfo:bitrateType
refsect2.para: The type of the bitrate. Examples may include CBR and VBR.

refsect2.title: nfo:codec
refsect2.para: The name of the codec necessary to decode a piece of media.

refsect2.title: nfo:audioOffset
refsect2.para: Specifies the start offset of this resource within a larger file, such as a single song within a recording of a radio broadcast or a CD rip.

refsect2.title: nfo:fileSize
refsect2.para: The size of the file in bytes. For compressed files it means the size of the packed file, not of the contents. For folders it means the aggregated size of all contained files and folders

refsect2.title: nfo:originalLocation
refsect2.para: The original location of the deleted resource.

refsect2.title: nfo:fileLastModified
refsect2.para: last modification date

refsect2.title: nfo:hasMediaFileListEntry
refsect2.para: This property is intended to point to an RDF list of MediaFiles.

refsect2.title: nfo:softwareCmdLine
refsect2.para: Command to launch the software

refsect2.title: nfo:regionOfInterestType
refsect2.para: The content of a region can be one of the predefined types in the spec

refsect2.title: nfo:bitsPerSample
refsect2.para: Amount of bits in each audio sample.

refsect2.title: nfo:lineCount
refsect2.para: The amount of lines in a text document

refsect2.title: nfo:averageVideoBitrate
refsect2.para: The average overall bitrate of a media container. (i.e. the size of the piece of media in bits, divided by it's duration expressed in seconds).

refsect2.title: nfo:definesFunction
refsect2.para: A name of a function/method defined in the given source code file.

refsect2.title: nfo:bitDepth
refsect2.para: A common superproperty for all properties signifying the amount of bits for an atomic unit of data. Examples of subproperties may include bitsPerSample and bitsPerPixel

refsect2.title: nfo:fileOwner
refsect2.para: The owner of the file as defined by the file system access rights feature.

refsect2.title: nfo:encoding
refsect2.para: The encoding used for the Embedded File. Examples might include BASE64 or UUEncode

refsect2.title: nfo:horizontalResolution
refsect2.para: Horizontal resolution of an image (if printed). Expressed in DPI.

refsect2.title: nfo:equipment
refsect2.para: Equipment used to create the media

refsect2.title: nfo:softwareIcon
refsect2.para: Icon of the software

refsect2.title: nfo:fileName
refsect2.para: Name of the file, together with the extension

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nfo:count
refsect2.para: A common superproperty for all properties signifying the amount of atomic media data units. Examples of subproperties may include sampleCount and frameCount.

refsect2.title: nfo:averageAudioBitrate
refsect2.para: The average overall bitrate of a media container. (i.e. the size of the piece of media in bits, divided by it's duration expressed in seconds).

refsect2.title: nfo:peakGain
refsect2.para: Peak Gain of media

refsect2.title: nfo:characterCount
refsect2.para: The amount of characters in the document.

refsect2.title: nfo:frontChannels
refsect2.para: Number of front channels.

refsect2.title: nfo:uncompressedSize
refsect2.para: Uncompressed size of the content of a compressed file.

refsect2.title: nfo:genre
refsect2.para: Genre of media

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nfo:lfeChannels
refsect2.para: Number of Low Frequency Expansion (subwoofer) channels.

refsect2.title: nfo:width
refsect2.para: Visual content width in pixels.

refsect2.title: nfo:height
refsect2.para: Visual content height in pixels.

refsect2.title: nfo:sampleRate
refsect2.para: The amount of audio samples per second.

refsect2.title: nfo:roiRefersTo
refsect2.para: Link to an item that is represented in the region. The 'type' of the region can give a clue of what exact content is linked in this property

refsect2.title: nfo:verticalResolution
refsect2.para: Vertical resolution of an Image (if printed). Expressed in DPI
